text:
some more details:
-specifying whole header as CDATA has the same result
-in some cases double quotes (") in <header> are _missing_ from resulting HTML 
 files, while single quotes are always present.
-there are no such problems on linux

The full (real life) problematic buildfile is at
http://cvs.makumba.org/build.xml , with bug described at
http://bugzilla.makumba.org/show_bug.cgi?id=593
The diff of the bugfix is available at:
http://cvs.makumba.org/build.xml.diff?r1=2.14&r2=2.15&f=h

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
This a javadoc (the executable) munging your arguments and I don't see anything
Ant could do about it.

I think this is a duplicate of the bug 18505 as the symptoms are the same - 
javadoc modifies the passed in arguments so the become useless on Windows but 
it works on Unix.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 18505 ***
